title.narrative: IR 2. LES NORMES QUALITÉ CONNUES ET APPL

description.narrative: By 2015,the education quality standards are known and applied., which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, (i) the primary school Gross Enrolment Rate (GER) increases from 72.4% in 2008-2009 to 100%, with a special focus on vulnerable children and those with special needs and (ii) the primary school Completion Rate (CR) increases from 45.9% in 2009-2010 to 75.1%, with special focus on girls.

title.narrative: By 2015,the education quality standards are known and applied.

description.narrative: Although primary completion rate remained stagnant at national level, 100% of schools in 15 out of 45 provinces are implementing the QCFS standards for improved quality of education. Innovations such as the speed learning for reading and the Safe School Strategy contributed to improved performance and strengthened resilience in schools | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018
